title: WPL 2025: Ashleigh Gardner Shines In GG's Dominant Win Over RCB
description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Gujarat Giants Highlights, WPL 2025: Ashleigh Gardner led from the front as Gujarat Giants snapped their losing streak.
excerpt: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Gujarat Giants Highlights, WPL 2025: Ashleigh Gardner led from the front as Gujarat Giants snapped their losing streak.
text: RCBW vs GG Highlights, WPL 2025© BCCI Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Gujarat Giants Highlights, WPL 2025: Ashleigh Gardner led from the front with a blazing 58 off 31 balls as bottom-placed Gujarat Giants snapped their losing streak with a dominant six-wicket win over Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the WPL in Bengaluru on Thursday. Opting to bowl, GG put on a disciplined bowling display, with Deandra Dottin (2/31) and Tanuja Kanwar (2/16) restricting RCB to a below-par 125/7. The offspin allrounder Gardner also chipped in with 1/22 in a tidy spell. GG took just 16.3 overs to seal victory, with Gardner smashing three sixes and six fours in her third fifty of the tournament. She raced to her half-century in just 28 balls, bringing it up in style with back-to-back sixes-a slog-sweep over long-on followed by a powerful hit over deep midwicket. (Scorecard) Topics mentioned in this article
html:
RCBW vs GG Highlights, WPL 2025© BCCI

Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Gujarat Giants Highlights, WPL 2025: Ashleigh Gardner led from the front with a blazing 58 off 31 balls as bottom-placed Gujarat Giants snapped their losing streak with a dominant six-wicket win over Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the WPL in Bengaluru on Thursday. Opting to bowl, GG put on a disciplined bowling display, with Deandra Dottin (2/31) and Tanuja Kanwar (2/16) restricting RCB to a below-par 125/7. The offspin allrounder Gardner also chipped in with 1/22 in a tidy spell. GG took just 16.3 overs to seal victory, with Gardner smashing three sixes and six fours in her third fifty of the tournament. She raced to her half-century in just 28 balls, bringing it up in style with back-to-back sixes-a slog-sweep over long-on followed by a powerful hit over deep midwicket. (Scorecard)
